intro: Erigeron striatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are white to pale blue with yellow centers. Erigeron striatus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
